xxl.applications.pipes
Class SWTSink<I>

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
          org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
              org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
                  xxl.applications.pipes.SWTSink<I>
Type Parameters:
I -
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, Heartbeat, Node, Sink<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class SWTSink<I>
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
implements Sink<I>, Heartbeat

Sink component in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface (GUI) using SWT. Therefore it needs swt.jar and plattfrom dependent libraries during run-time. With the help of this GUI a user is able to start, stop, pause and resume the processing of a sink.
Moreover the string representation of the elements streaming in can be displayed. If this sink stops its processing, the number of elements that streamed in and the time spent for their processing are displayed.

SWTSink

protected SWTSink(Source<? extends I> source,
                  int sourceID,
                  String name,
                  boolean printObjects,
                  boolean println,
                  org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                  int style,
                  boolean internalCall,
                  boolean printHB)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This sink uses the given ID for subscription.
name - The string displayed in outer frame.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.
println - If true the elements' string representation is separted by a CR/LF, otherwise not.
parent - the parent composite of this swtsink.
style - the style of this composite.
internalCall - a flag, signing that the constructor is invoked by a factory method.
refreshTime - the refresh time for the gui.

SWTSink

public SWTSink(Source<? extends I> source,
               String name,
               boolean printObjects,
               org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
               int style)
Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separted by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured. The refresh time is set to 100 ms.

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
name - The string displayed in outer frame.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.
parent - the parent composite of this swtsink.
style - the style of this composite.

Creates a new terminal sink in a query graph that provides a simple graphical user interface.
The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separted by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured.
The frame's name is set to "Graphical User Interface (Sink)".

Parameters:
source - This sink gets subscribed to the specified source.
printObjects - If true the string representation of the elements is displayed in the GUI, otherwise not.
parent - the parent composite of this swtsink.
style - the style of this composite.

The DEFAULT_ID is used for subscription. The elements' string representation is separted by a CR/LF. The input rate is not measured.
The frame's name is set to "Graphical User Interface (Sink)". No string representation of the incoming elements is display.

process

public void process(I o,
                    int sourceID)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: Sink
This method will be called in the transfer method of each source this sink got subscribed to. The element to be transferred will be sent to this sink selecting it as the first paramenter. The second parameter specifies the ID this sink used during its subscription. Therefore, the ID determines from which source this elements is from.
The element should not be cloned if it is transferred to multiple sinks which have been registered by a source. Due to performance reasons this source should rather use the same element and pass it to all subscribed sinks based on the assumption that these sinks will not perform any changes on this element, unless they clone it themselves.

Specified by:
process in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
o - The element streaming in.
sourceID - The ID this sink specified during its subscription by an underlying source.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the given element or ID is incorrect.

done

public void done(int sourceID)
Description copied from interface: Sink
The method done is invoked, if the source with ID ID runs out of elements.

Specified by:
done in interface Sink<I>

addSource

public boolean addSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                         int sourceID)
                  throws SinkIsDoneException
Description copied from interface: Sink
Similar to the subscribe method of a source, this method establishes a connection between a sink and a source during runtime. The intention of both methods is to build up a double-linked query graph that is completely navigatable.
The method should be used to store a reference to the given underlying source together with the ID specified during this sink's subscription.

Specified by:
addSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The ID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the source has successfully been added, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

removeSource

public boolean removeSource(Source<? extends I> source,
                            int sourceID)
                     throws SinkIsDoneException
Description copied from interface: Sink
In conformity to the unsubscribe method of a source, this method removes the connection between a sink and a source on the sink's side. It removes the given source with ID ID from the internal datastructure used to store this sink's references to its sources.

Specified by:
removeSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
source - The source this sink got subscriped to.
sourceID - The ID this sinks used during its subscription by the specified source.
Returns:
Returns true, if the remove operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.

                              throws SinkIsDoneException,
                                     IllegalArgumentException,
                                     IndexOutOfBoundsException
Description copied from interface: Sink
Returns a reference to a source belonging to the specified index, i.e., the index which was returned for this source when the method addSource was called.

Specified by:
getSource in interface Sink<I>
Parameters:
index - The index used to access sources in an internal datastructure of this sink.
Returns:
The source belonging to the specified index.
Throws:
SinkIsDoneException - If the sink has already finished its processing.
IllegalArgumentException - If no sources have been added.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index does not exist.

getSourceID

public int getSourceID(Source<? extends I> source)
                throws SinkIsDoneException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: Sink
Returns the first matching ID this sink used during its subscription by the specified source. This ID has already been stored, when the addSource method was invoked.

Returns:
The ID this sink specified during its subscription.
Throws:

IllegalArgumentException - If the specified sources has not been added.
